isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - SLAVE VALVE

step1.para: Lubricate the O-rings on the sleeve with a silicone lubricant such as Dow Corning #111 Silicon Grease or equivalent.

note.para: If the part number on the sleeve is 2245-H-1126 or 2245-A-1067, replace the sleeve with part number 1692837C2.

step1.para: Install the small end of the sleeve in the bore in the slave valve.
Install the spring on the actuator pin. Install the pin and spring assembly in the main case. Make sure the tip on the pin is toward the slave valve (Figure 352).

figure.caption: Figure 352. Install Spring on Actuator Pin

step1.para: On Design Level 1 Nine-Speed Transmissionsonly, install a new gasket in position on the back of the slave valve. Design Level 2 Nine and Ten-Speed Transmissions do not use a gasket.
Install the slave valve and the gasket in position on the main case.
Install the mounting bolts and washers for the slave valve. Tighten the bolts to 10 to 13 Nm (85 to 115 in-lbs.).
Connect the air lines to the slave valve ( Figure 353).

figure.caption: Figure 353. Connect Air Lines to Slave Valve

step2.para: Connect the BLACK 1/8 or 5/32 inch outer diameter air line to the pilot port fitting (stamped letter "P" on the valve).
Connect the RED 1/8 or 5/32 inch outer diameter air line to the pilot supply port fitting (stamped letters "PS" on the valve).
Connect the RED 1/4 or 5/16 inch outer diameter air line to the supply fitting (stamped letter "S").
Connect the BLACK 1/4 or 5/16 inch outer diameter air line to the LO range fitting (stamped letter "L").
Connect the BLUE 1/4 or 5/16 inch outer diameter air line to the HI range fitting (stamped letter "H").
